overview:
Brandon K. Hill is the CEO of btrax, Inc., a San Francisco based creative agency specializing in Branding and Web Solutions for clients to and from the Asian market. With strong connections to the Japanese Startup community, his interviews often show up on some of the top Japanese media including Nikkei, Wall Street Journal, and TechCrunch Japan. Brandon is one of the mentors at Startup Weekend Bay Area, and has been a guest speaker at the annual UC Berkeley Business Conference.

Originally from Sapporo, Brandon K. Hill makes his home in San Francisco, but calls the world his office.

Born to a Japanese mother and American father, the bi-cultural stage was set from an early age for his later creation of btrax. After graduating from highschool in Japan, Brandon made the leap to the U.S., earning an Industrial Arts degree at San Francisco State University before forming btrax straight out of college with two Japanese friends with only $5,000 of start-up funds.
